Often it seems like a good Lovestory is all about the world the couple lives in...but what if the world they live in, isn't the same? (not to mention, this isn't a romance movie most of the time. Hah, got you.)
The answer is, the most beautiful film I have seen since I was a child. It starts with the lovely characters and ends with the amazing animation that will guide you through a perfect story for anyone who loves a bit of a twist in the storyline. I think the movie deserves a metaphorical approach: It's like a star in the universe only you and your loved one can see, no matter how far apart the loving souls are.

reviews.review_title: A fantastic animation, Makoto Shinkai is the future
reviews.content: After releasing a gradually improving set of animations including 5 centimetres per second Shinkai has really compressed everything great about his style and fixed many of the things which troubled his previous work. Make no mistake this is the type of anime able to rival such renowned Studio Ghibli titles as "My Neighbour Toro" and "Howl's Moving Castle". No doubt this will soon go down as a classic. Without getting into spoilers "Your Name" is a compelling immersive anime experience with Shinkai making many, albeit risky, decisions none more rewarding than choosing one of his favourite bands RADWIMPS to act as the soundtrack. The artwork is detailed, beautiful and crisp whilst losing nothing in the natural movements of characters. This is the animation to show people new to anime. Its universal appeal lying in the themes of young love as well as tasteful amounts of science fiction. Whilst the writing and montage scenes may at times seem out of place the films ever-changing and expanding plot makes this a film viewers will easily connect with. A truly wonderful film, and a gem amongst other anime movies in the last 5 years. Makoto Shinkai has here created what may be his magnum opus and can be certainly considered as a possible heir to to Hayao Miyazaki.

I have watched a lot of Anime films, and have heard recently that Your Name is very popular, an amazing film, heartfelt, top seller, etc. However, I feel Most Ghibli films and other anime films such as Wolf Children to be much better (sorry for the comparison). But, me watching so many of these kinds of films and reading a lot of manga similar to it; seemed very cliché.It didn't really felt like the plot had a message to convey, though I did really enjoy the plot. I personally love the swap body plot-line in manga. But I feel, it is not really original and some aspects over-used. I felt a strong resemblance to 5mm per second. What mainly spoilt the film for me was the singing. It was the same song and was used around 4 times over the course of the whole film. This got annoying and I went straight to turning the film off as soon as it went on credits. Which I don't do in other films I really enjoy. Though it is personal preference on the song used, I think it's a bit too much to use the same song 4 times in a film. Actually, I don't see any need to use it more than once!I also didn't feel any heart strings pull like other anime films for me. Although, I would say the art is outstanding and really pretty. (though I do wish when characters cry in anime, they make it more realistic with the face, too much perfection.)All this is just my opinion though. I would not say "Don't watch it because it's crap", I just think it's overrated.

"I feel like I'm always searching for someone, or something."Two words that best describe this piece for me: Ethereal and Unexpected. The surprise of watching a good movie without having it given out to you only by the trailer is rather unusual. However, Your Name is a film in which you dive into the story and as the minutes pass by you realize that what had everything to be just another love story with predictable scenes is nothing but unexpected.
Beyond the unexpected factor, the story revolves around the idea of fate and time as a crucial element to the narrative. Therefore, the idea of the unexpected links perfectly with the notion of how people may be actually expected in others' lives, which also brings up the concept of The Red String Of Fate.
Besides the romantic premise, the plot also holds a great twist for those who think that it is going to be as recycled as many of nowadays' love story productions.
In conclusion, Kimi no Na wa is a lovely mix of drama, romance, fantasy and even adventure, which contributes to the like of many viewers. With Ethereal looking scenes and even better quotes, it's an emotional production full of meanings and concepts throughout the storyline!

reviews.review_title: Review for Kimi no na wa.
reviews.content: Your name is one of the best animated film in my life.I like full of the movie.Two teenagers share a profound, magical connection upon discovering they are swapping bodies. Things manage to become even more complicated when the boy and girl decide to meet in person.

I was a little confused at first not knowing the story beforehand, but as it progresses, you learn to understand the timelines and what's going on with the two main characters. It conveys such strong emotion, humor, and love within each life we follow. The second half of the film was nerve-wracking for me--I never thought an animation could cause me so much stress in such a short period of time. However, it was WELL worth it. Even if you don't like animation/anime, please check out this film! It might change your perspective forever.

One of the movies that gave me goosebumps and amazement at the same time because of the unexpected storyline and amazing animation. I truly recommend to see this movie. The animationsare out of this world and the story is really touching and you won't forget it.10/10 will see it several times more.

In a world dominated by stupid sequels, prequels and remakes it is film/anime like this that restores hope in today's entertainment.Not only it is emotional and feels real, it delivers a relevant message. I love the imagination and palette but also appreciate that it aims to remind us of social issues that we should be paying attention to.The only reason I don't give our heroes and their story a 10/10 is that I still feel a couple of Miyazaki movies (like Kiki, Chihiro and the racoon dogs) were just that much better and showed a little more imagination.Whatever the case I live in fear of the Hollywood announced remake by Hollywood hack JJ Abrams who has never shown any talent or vision. As with others I will ignore and boycott that coming insult and always cherish kimi no na wa.

reviews.review_title: Will remember it until I grow old.
reviews.content: I've watched it the first time in 2019 as a student. I remember literally seeing the ad for it on our tv, and was hooked by it. I literally waited days for it to show and I was surprised by the connection it will make to my self. This is one of the few movies that made me feel nostalgia. The plot is quite unique, soundtrack is very awesome, art style is great, and the plot is quite confusing for my young mind but still great. I've re watched it and it still is a great movie in my opinion even though there's a few plot holes.I am quite saddened and was disappointed when I learned about the live action like what Disney was doing to all of its old movies. The "magic" surrounding the whole movie will be lost and will never be reproduced by any CGI.

reviews.review_title: "Experience the power of love and loss with "Your Name", the critically acclaimed anime movie that will leave you speechless"
reviews.content: "Your Name" is a beautifully crafted and emotionally powerful anime movie that tells the heart-wrenching story of two teens, Mitsuha and Taki, who are mysteriously able to switch bodies with each other.The animation is absolutely stunning, with breathtaking landscapes and beautifully detailed character designs. The music is also excellent, with a mix of traditional Japanese instruments and modern pop sounds that perfectly complement the movie's themes and mood.But what really sets "Your Name" apart is its captivating and emotionally resonant story. The movie deals with themes of loss, longing, and the bonds of family and friendship in a way that is both heartfelt and thought-provoking.Overall, "Your Name" is a must-see for fans of anime and anyone looking for a beautifully crafted and emotionally powerful film experience. So, I would highly recommend it.

reviews.review_title: 2 minutes into this movie and I knew I would adore this movie
reviews.content: I saw this movie two years ago and I remember ending the movie and feeling like my 900 other ratings on IMDB were meaningless. Your name. Is by far the best movie I have ever seen. Its ahead of all the 10/10 ratings I have ever given and I give 10/10 really rarely.The score, the story, the animations, the ending, the love story, the twists and the emotion that this movie gave me left me crying happily for minutes after it was done.RADWIMP did such a great job in both the korean and the english version. I would encourage anybody to watch this movie. Its wholesome, its happy, its sad, its everything and its worth it.The coldest of hearts couldnt resist this movie, its perfection.
Even thought the story can be a bit hard to follow it's one of best movies ever.

This is not a regular love story or a love story at all, this film was simply espetacular in so many levels. Characters are so amazing, the story... Oh, god, the story. To whomever is reading this, do yourself a favor and watch this film.

I am really lost for words, this movie is perfection. Such beautiful animation and backgrounds that are some of the best ever made together with great directing and amazing writing. I do not want to spoil anything at all so Im just gonna say that you have to watch this work of art.
Just do it!

From start till end what movie offers you is nothing but a wonder journey of two people. A love story beyond imagination.
Animation is top class, the scenes with comets are truly breath taking.
A must watch even if you are not into anime. This movie will make your day.

reviews.review_title: One of my favourite movies ever.......
reviews.content: I usually never write reviews on movies, but this movie is so special for me, the amount of times I have watched this movie. Whenever I want to feel some positivity or a sense of something to ease my mind I watch this movie. The animations, music and everything about it is so well made and beautiful. The story is also amazing and the character relationship development of the main characters are also so good. I absolutely love this movie and will always have a part in my heart.

This is unique anime. I like it.
If you tired of repetitious animations, switch to this anime.

For me seeing your name is just like a passionate hug from someone very dear to me.... The warmth of my heart continues deep inside. No matter how many times I have seen this or will see this it always move me deeper and more deeper. it gives a current of excitement and emotions in its own way. I can feel every bit that Makoto Shinkai Put in this work. The jaw dropping animations , the passion in music, the breath catching moments , even the smallest details become magical.May be it is not a masterpiece, may be there r many films better than this.
But for me there will be less better films than your name, there will be far more superior film than ' Your Name ' but there is no film like ' Your name '.
You know, there r some moments , when just a good work surpasses brilliant doings. Miracle pushes through realities. Willpower conquers destiny. And at that moment, when your heart overcome your mind.... That feeling is " Your Name " for me....
YES I DO LOVE YOUR NAME. I LOVE UNCONDITIONALLY. AND I ALWAYS DO.
It makes me believe in miracles. It makes me believe that, someone far enough , waiting for me, who is just made for me and me only. It makes me believe that, if your love is so faithful, faithful enough for each other then even nature finds way to your union.
YOU ARE SO DESTINED TO BE TOGETHER, THAT EVEN DESTINY CAN NOT MAKES YOU APART.------------ That is your name for me. My true fillings, a faithful and unconditional love ....

A really disappointing animation by Shinkai Makoto. I used to love his work like "5 Centimeters Per Second" but this time he created a mass of kitsch. Yes the animation is beautiful but it can't tell the story. "Your Name." is just a bad taste anime to entertain the audience, and show how Makoto lost his own vision and style to made a popular popcorn movie (like Michael Bay did). The thing I can't stand the most is how the people keep hyping this movie (even Makoto told people do not go to the theater watch this movie). The main characters are empty. They didn't have a real interaction, I cannot understand why the people think this is emotional. Okay maybe the emotion doesn't really need to be rational but I hardly feel the characters' mind. At the end, the story cannot express any feeling (the music is not suitable for the mood too).In conclude, the whole anime is disappointing. The reason is not about how bad it is, it's about how Makoto fail to be an artist, and a stylist he could be.

Emotional and visually stunning. I can't even begin to explain how much this film has left a mark on me.During the first quarter of the film, I was so sure I knew how it would end. This isn't exactly a completely new concept so I was sure the rest of the film would be sweet but so predictable. I'm so happy to say that I was completely wrong.Instead I was on the edge of my seat the entire film, it was so tense whilst also coming across as hilarious and heartwarming. I'm annoyed at how long it has taken me to sit down and watch it.Definitely give this a go, whether like me you have been watching anime for years or you never have. I assure you that you won't regret it.
I don't see how anything can top this. This is my favorite movie and will probably always be one of my favorites.

reviews.review_title: Can't shake off the feeling from movie long after...
reviews.content: Just finished watching it for the first time, and I wish and feel I am still immersed in it. Emotion took a wild ride and now I am trapped somewhere between the movie and reality.It was beautifully made and very descriptive. It reminded me of my stay in Kyoto when I was younger: peaceful, quiet and pleasant. Also my memories from visiting Tokyo too;it was very busy, full of high rises and everyone were minding their own issues. The level of details from many scenes were breathtaking, having done a little bit of animation really make me appreciate the amount of hard work the artists put into this anime.Then were was the story, starts off as cute and lighthearted, then deeper, and more pure, it takes you on a roller coaster ride, and before you know it, the movie ends.I wish there is more after the ending, but then it wouldn't be a masterpiece. I can only put this beautiful memory from watching the movie in a safe place in the heart and treasure it, watch it again to re live it.

reviews.review_title: Not bad but Not Great either
reviews.content: First of all, I would give it a 6 but I gave it 1 to counter all those ratings.Now, I was really hyped for this movie. Seeing wallpapers here and their, watching the trailer, I developed heaven level expectations for this film. But when I actually watched it, it dint please me. The music was excellent and the animation was really detailed and colorful. But I found the screenwriting really, really bad. It had a great concept, but the dialogues were so unsatisfying. They didn't do much to make the movie enjoyable or progress smoothly and the way the story advanced was off. People praise the pacing but I had a lot of troubles with it. For instance getting adjusted to their new life was compressed into a song when it was the most fun part, when it should have been given more time. And like half of the movie went to saving the town which was boring and predictable. Many people like it so they must have something to like it. But I just couldn't enjoy it. It would not make it into a list of my top twenty fav anime films. At least I still listen to the music.
Great animated film with really good story line and romance. The animation is excellent!

From the jaw-dropping animation, splendid visuals ,the amazing background scores, this is something every movie lover should watch. Being a fan of Shinkai's work , I expected nothing less and believe me, this movie will not disappoint!!!I originally mistook it for another teen movie but the unique and amazing story evoloves into much more over the course of the film.The characters are well defined and likeable.The visuals are amazing, breathing life into the tiniest of details. I don't want to go much into the story. I assure you,this movie will entertain you with its special humor. Just go watch it !!!!

reviews.review_title: I don't cry with anything but this...
reviews.content:
Can you fall in love with someone you've never met?
For stories as exciting and full of feeling as this is that I really appreciate Japanese animation. It takes us to the story of two strangers with completely different lives who are destined to find themselves following the already known Legend of the Red Thread with the only drawback that without prior notice, both change their bodies, which forces them to live in each other's personal lives and they can not remember the other's name and their threads are intertwined with time. I was left with my mouth open with its animation so polished, with the warm landscapes and how real the characters feel. Without falling short, explore this concept passionately, as Miyazaki Movies has us so accustomed. I have cried, I have smiled and I have learned that true love waits. Do yourself a favor and watch this movie and try not to be filled with tears like I did.

It was very sweet. I liked how the characters were blue to connect and the twist at the end. I wish we could see why happened after but I am sad it didn't show. Though that fact adds mystery to the plot.

reviews.review_title: A Different Kind of Love Story
reviews.content: Kimi no na wa (Your Name) isn't your typical love story you usually get from American cinema. I won't give much away because truly this film is something that you need to experience. There are supernatural elements involved in the story but it didn't feel out of place or forced. This film wastes no time, every single minute was used to either develop a character, move the story forward, or place perspective of what a character is experiencing. The two main characters in the film have so much development and you start to see their growth as they navigate through the supernatural occurrence. There are moments of joy, laughter, suspense, depression, but most importantly you will fall in love with the story and the gorgeous 2D hand drawn animation. As a person who doesn't watch a lot of anime and a lover of film do yourself a favor, watch this film. The English Dub had wonderful voice acting, if you most comfortable watching it in English, do so. The ending is a tear jerker especially if you come to appreciate the meaning of love.
The best anime movie I was seen because the lighting was very good and the movie time is as short as a good movie

Beautiful story that makes you cry.The story of love that can't be explained but can live through time. Animation that makes your brain explode like you a child again when you see something like "Lion King". Voices, sounds and all other thing that makes it beautiful and perfect. I sincerely regret that i can't forget it to see it like i saw it at the first time.Makoto Shinkai you are genius.

reviews.review_title: The Most Emotional Anime Movie I've ever seen!
reviews.content: Your Name was already released in cinema in 2016 but I knew and watched it in 2017. The genre of this movie is romance, but it combines with mystery, supernatural, and little bit comedy. The romantic scenes that shown in this movie is not too excessive, but can make the viewers fall in love with it, like me.The movie shows some places in Tokyo that the main character named Taki lives. Those places are made as similar as in real Tokyo. The movie also never forget to add Japan cultures in the story. It just like the girl named Mitsuha do. In her village culture, she must make an alcohol kuchikami-zake. The fireworks festival that annually held in Japan is shown in this movie.This anime movie gives a big emotional impact to the viewers. For you who have not watch this movie before, you should prepare your heart. Because in the middle until the end of the story, you will get some scenes that can drain your emotion. Even some viewers are crying when they watch it. The sound effect is also make this movie feel alive. The soundtracks are success to bring more emotional feeling to viewers by the instrument and the meaning of the songs that have a deep meaning.The mystery and supernatural side of this movie has shown with how the body of Mitsuha and Taki can be switched despite different place and time. On the comedy side is when they do their activities with that switched body. This movie success to beat other movies that had popular before such as Spirited Away, 5cm per Second and many more. Overall this is the most emotional movie anime I've ever seen! And actually after I watch this movie, I can't move on to other movies until now!

Two-hour wanderings and reasoningThe picture turned out to be rather chaotic. There is no clarity and logic in its plot, and sometimes what is shown on the screen is not explained or argued to us at all.From the positive:Gorgeous landscape painting. I don't know why, but I was nostalgic for my childhood at the time of showing all these green fields, clearest lakes and summer skies.Demonstration of some traditions and rituals of the Japanese people. I am not a devoted fan of anime, and therefore, when watching this genre, I look for some new feature of the Japanese people in each individual cartoon, which I did not know about until that moment.From the negative:Empty plot. After watching two hours of this picture, try to think about the main events that "Your Name" is so filled with. There are only two of them. First, the process of transmigration of souls and getting used to a new body. This is the most exciting and dynamic part of this anime, but, unfortunately, it is very short in its timing. Then comes the most boring search for each other, during which there are uninteresting arguments and conclusions of the main characters.Plot mix. Where are we now anyway? What's happening? What time period are we in? At times, the viewer is shown scenes, when viewing which you ask all these questions. In the picture itself, we very rarely answer them.Unnatural. I understand that this is fantasy, but my indignation does not fly towards the phenomenon of the transmigration of souls, but into the tune of the relationships and life situations demonstrated in the picture. A teenager quits work and studies to go along an unknown route with an unknown goal, and the same adventurer friends help him in this, who, of course, also leave all their affairs for later, because you need to help a friend. Funny.The final. What kind of final is this? In the first part of the film, you couldn't even remember her name right after the dream, and then a few years later you manage to turn to each other in a huge city! And the scene itself is shown somehow fleetingly.

This has grown to be one of my favorite movies of all time and I never get tired of it. One particular thing I noticed in the movie is how different the first half of the movie is compared to the second. Almost like two stories in the same universe, which implies on how detailed, satisfying and important the animation, music and every line in the movie are. It is an astonishing experience and, surprisingly, in only 1.5 hours. This is very intriguing because the movie feels much more than that.The animation is absolutely beautiful and lovely to the naked eye. The music drags the viewers into something that is indescribable, something so deep and benevolent that it's hard to pinpoint where this feeling exactly emerges from. The movie connects the fundamentals of this world to the edge of our current time. Somewhere between the beauty in Japanese lakes, forests, mountains, ancient traditions and myths all the way to the breathtaking cityscapes of Tokyo, a love bond between a city-boy Taki and country-girl Mitsuha defines how powerful and important love could be, and how the beauty of our nature needs to be protected.
I have many question about this very moving film. But the biggest one probably is...Why would you make so many door shots?

Is the cinema a vehicle for beautiful images independent of the narrative purpose of the film? Your Name is one of the most stunningly animated features I have ever seen, but the level of emotional resonance is somewhat far south of my favorite Studio Ghibli Films which this film purports to surpass (or equal.) What is the ultimate point of this movie? The body swapping story is obviously old-hat, but I felt it would lead to something grand, eventually. But (spoilers- don't read reviews when you don't want spoilers!) when the comet angle surfaced, I thought that things might finally get interesting. But instead, the film built up to a climax with basically a Get out of Jail Free Card idea. (I note that Taki summarily rejects a sexpot who is a great person from all evidence, and makes him look like an asshole in the process.) I recall that Isao Takahata's Only Yesterday was supposed to be a merely "good" animation from Studio Ghibli. Disney wouldn't even release it due to a frank discussion about female periods. But that film made me cry, and several times on a repeat viewing. Now, in that film's quiet, realistic, and understated style, why did I find such deep resonance, but a love story where a comet (spoilers!!!) wipes out an entire town cannot? I have to spread the blame around to all in Creative.That being said, this is a very good animated film from Japan, but I have to say it doesn't quite live up to its hype. It's a bit too emo and heavy handed. There are many parts where the lead characters scream out each other's name. There's no subtlety at all. Me thinks that the amazing images fool people when married to a heavy handed approach to presenting emotional content. Another refresher if you want an awesome coming of age story from Japanese masters, check out Whisper of the Heart. There's nothing in Your Name that matches the awe of Shizuku discovering the antique shop for the first time, and meeting the Baron... (sigh) This, without even bringing up Spirited Away.

reviews.review_title: Amazingly beautiful scenes and touching storyline
reviews.content: This is certainly a good movie. Although it does not have a lot new creative elements in the plot, it can combine different elements such as soul exchange, time travel, the existence of a disaster into a love story and handle it so well that people do not feel really weird when watching this.The movie also sustain the tradition of Makoto's Shinkai movies, which has a lot of breath-taking scenes and wonderful songs and soundtracks. The artistic scenes can definitely draw people into the mood and atmosphere of the love story and make people feel more related and touching.A lot of scenes in the movie are based on real life places, the creators spends hours to paint them and recreated them in an anime world. The beautiful drawings also shows that the creators not only possess the top skills in creating animation movies in Japan, but also knows the beauty and attractiveness of Japan such that they can capture the subtle yet beautiful Eastern Japanese feelings across different scenes.Overall speaking, this could one of the greatest anime movies of all time in Japanese animation history.

"Your Name" starts with a premise that is familiar from other supernatural comedies: two Japanese teens - country girl Mitsuha and Tokyo boy Taki - find themselves repeatedly switching bodies in their dreams, leading to some predictably silly comedy regarding body parts, as well as the expected love story. But what sounds like a romantic riff on "Freaky Friday" soon turns into something stranger and more mysterious, as writer-director Makoto Shinkai introduces an element of time travel and the transmigration of souls that thickens, if not deepens, the plot.
The film's crisp and clean visuals are genuinely lovely, and they sharply render the distinctions between Taki's hectic urban life and Mitsuha's sleepy rural home. But a sound track featuring cheesy, power-rock ballads often overwhelms the pretty visuals. And the narrative - which involves not just straightforward body-switching but the theme of destinies intertwined - can get a bit confusing. At one point, Taki, while he is "possessed" by the spirit of Mitsuha, tries to find her - or is that him? - on the astral plane by drinking kuchikamizake, which is essentially the alcoholic fermented spit of Mitsuha. You may need a shot of that for any of this to make sense.
Amazing pictures, amazing music and an even more amazing storyline!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: An Out Of Body Experience, Literally
reviews.content: "I feel like I'm always searching for someone, or something." Haven't we all felt that at some point in our lives? Growing up, Japan dominated the animated film industry with masterpieces such as "Spirited Away," "Princess Mononoke," and "Howls Moving Castle," all being directed by none other than the legendary director, Hayao Miyazaki. Since his retirement, no other Japanese animated film has never peaked near his standards, with most of them being usually mediocre. Not until 2016, when Japan's "Your Name" made headlines due to its astounding success in its native country. The film had gain lots of attention from the western world, with many (including critics) believing that the Film "Your Name" had stood on the precipice of becoming a global sensation. From my personal experience, after watching the film, I can assure you that this is an animated film like no other. With the blend of its beautiful animations and complex storyline, the movie made me wish I could literally erase my memory and watch it again."Your Name," a 2d animated film directed by Makoto Shinkai, deals with the ties people have, the effects custom and tradition have on people, and how time weaves everything together. The movie is heavily influenced by an Asian myth called "The Red Thread" or "String of Fate." The belief goes that two people connected by this thread are destined to be together no matter what time, place, or circumstance. This is the main concept that the film expands upon. Adding on to that, the film presents the idea of a greater power of tying things together called "Musubi." Weaving threads is Musubi, people sharing bonds and relationships is Musubi, and the literal flow of time is Musubi.Now because this film is obviously a masterpiece, I'm not going to spoil the whole movie for you, but I will go just enough to say that this is a film that does answer most questions that arises in the mind of viewers, but just not in the way you might think. While watching the film, you may get some semblance of an explanation for the body-swapping between the two main characters Taki and Mitsuha, but less of who or what is causing it and more of an answer to the problem that the swapping was meant to solve. There is a lot of that with this film, particularly, and it is masterful in the way it answers your questions, and it placates you for those it chooses to avoid. Some other films might just have some magic be the cause of things occurring because reasons and the plot to be a string of coincidences, but "your name" avoids the coincidences entirely and gives you just enough so that it can focus far more on being a tale of fate. Overall, this tale of fate can be exposited more with the theme of the red string of fate that ties the two main characters together.Overall, I believe Makoto Shinkai nailed this film all with nice touches. The little, tiny things with the narrative and how the characters act or react on their own seem small and insignificant but overall help flesh out everyone's development far more than he's ever done compared to his past films. For example, the little messages that the two main characters send to each other's notes or reminders on their phone on the diary app while being swapped in each other's bodies seemed small and insignificant at first. Over time, the character development between the two occurs as both of each other start caring for one another even though they have never met. Because of this, "Your Name" is, without a doubt in my mind, the best film Makoto Shinkai has made or even more the best-animated film ever made. This story does so much more than tell you a tale of relatable characters; instead, juxtaposes so many elements, male and female, city and country, spirituality and science, present and future, all in under just two hours. It is both an epic sci-fi adventure and a heartwarming romance wrapped in such an artistic fashion that is second to none.

This is the second Makoto Shinkai movie that i have seen. The first one i saw was 5 Centimeters per second. Since then i have started following his work.
Your name is a Japanese animated romantic fantasy film. It is the story about a high school boy who study in Tokyo and a girl from the countryside who accidently and inexplicably swap their bodies.
Starting from the story part Overall, the narrative is well organized. The events narrated that are not confusing. The length of the content is not too long and it was cleaver, how the director make a emotional scene with the character. There are many impressive scenes. The story showing difference about people who live in the city and people who live in countryside, Local tradition, including the use of supernatural events, make the story more interesting.
As for the animation work, the work shown are meticulous in making. Show the intention of the creator. In some scenes of the movie the images that projected make the feeling of being in that real place. The facial expressions and gestures of the characters also performed naturally.
The soundtrack used in the movie and the tempo of the song are perfectly and feels good. There are many scenes that make me feel impressed and amenable to the emotions of the characters in the movie.
My feeling after watching this movie, the movie has a variety of feeling and with all the elements in the movie, this is the first movie that gives me the most emotion. This is the movie that even if you come back to watch it again, it will never get bored and always retrace your first feeling when you watching it first time.

The story is fancy and modern. I like the plot that the boy from the city and the girl from the rural town are switching the bodies. I like how they show their culture in 2 side (countryside & city). The scene in the movie is very beautiful.
Especially when the comet is separating itself. Some place is used from the real one such as Shinjuku, Shinano-machi station pedestrian bridge and Yotsuya Station. The movie soundtracks of this movie are really good too. That are sung by the Japanese rock band name Radwimps. I can listen the playlist of these songs for month!

reviews.review_title: A wonderfully crafted one of a kind film
reviews.content: This movie is the perfect and beautiful blend of tradition, mythology, fantasy, and above all, the physical and emotional bonding between two persons.It excels in capturing the emotions and feelings that the characters go through, and the most remarkable thing is that it does a great job in taking the audience through the very same emotions. I just finished watching it and still can't get over it. It starts off simple and slow, setting up the scene along with character introduction and development. While the 2nd half is just amazing and breath-taking, with lots of surprises, emotions, and a unique storyline unfolding before you.The direction is top notch. Music is captivating as well, wonderfully capturing the essence of the movie. The storyline shown in the movie is totally unpredictable. You feel the characters, feel for the characters the entire time and the ending leaves you feeling with a mix of emotions. It is very different from other friendship and romance movies that are made now a days.The animation is greatly detailed and takes the visuals to a whole new level, making it so much more emotionally expressive, which I felt is another factor that makes this movie so unique, separating it from other animated movies.
I just love this movie. My favourite movie of all time. I was not watching anime before but after watching this movie I'm literally addicted to anime.

Such a real drawing of falling snow, dawn, so diverse is the bright blue image of a comet - at least because of this, it is necessary to watch this film.Although the beginning of the film did not portend anything aesthetic, the exchange of bodies as in a primitive Hollywood comedy, fast-forward footage of how the characters live in this mode, how they wake up, advise, laugh. And according to all the canons, the moment of loss of connection, loss of common consciousness, the beginning of the drama has come. The realization has come that the city you saw in your dream was destroyed 3 years ago, the realization has come that you have lost something important. So sad, because nothing can be returned.But there is always hope for a miracle, for an infinitely strong connection with our past, which winds through the entire film like a thin ribbon. And it is no longer clear where the reality is, who is racing on a bicycle, who is writing a name on the palm of his hand, who is blowing up a substation, who is persuading the mayor's father to evacuate, at what time all this happens.But this connection saves hundreds of people from death, gives us a chance for the final, which should be.But the film is not about that, the film is about finding the one person you are looking for or not looking for all your life. But only in the film it must necessarily be, and in life it is more satisfaction of the need for care, help, pleasure, care from loneliness. In adult life, this melody no longer plays. We will not dream about our man, and we will never see a thin ribbon on the hair of our destiny in the subway.

Kimi no Na wa. (Your Name.), It's an animation movie by director Makoto Shinkai that I've been waiting for for so long. He has his unique stunning storytelling and art style. All of his past movies were giving a weird feeling for me. It's a feeling of heartwarming but loneliness at the same time. "Your name." Is the story that I've been repeating watching it for more than 5 times and not stopping to enjoy watching it at all.The story of Your name.:
Your name is the story that takes place in Japan. The story talks about a city boy named Taki and a country girl named Mitsuha. One day, they woke up and found that their bodies were swapped. At first, there didn't notice what actually cause them to swap their body. Later on, the problem starts to appear, so they need to fix it.My opinion about Your name.:
At first, I thought "Your name." will be a normal drama-romance movie based on director's previous work, but their story talks more than just a normal romance movie. The story of Your Name is fantastic. The story is about a beautiful combination of mystery, miracle, and belief. The storytelling in the movie is quite slow but it gets me exciting in every second of the movie because even the mood and tone of "Your Name." is quite slow but they keep giving me so much detail and information in 1 slow scene. The dialogue is funny at first and punch us with a lot of impact quote later. The story is quite easy and solid to follow but if you look deeply into it, there is a lot of detail spreading in every second of this movie that would make you love this movie even more. I've watched this movie more than 5 times and the story, character motivation, and my feeling in this movie have been changing every time I watch it. In my opinion, this is the charm of an Asian movie because it can touch the deepest of our feeling with a tiny bit different dialogue or story. The relationship of the main characters is well balance compared to the story. The ending is quite interesting. To be honest, this movie is too good to have an end. The visual is stunning. Every bit of detail gives me a feeling of heartwarming. Even I've not been to Tokyo before but every picture in this movie makes me feel like I'm living in Tokyo for so long. I'm surprised that most of every detail in this movie is drawn by hands. The animation is so smooth, thanks to all effort put together to create is stunning visual. I could say that in my opinion, this is the most beautiful anime movie of all time. The sound effect and music are so beautiful. The music is all in Japanese so I cannot understand most of it, but I can feel it. The music means a lot to the story. It can even say the intention of the main characters without any word spoken from them. The sound effect makes the picture feel alive and strongly pulls us to their world. Last but not least, do not expect this movie to be a teenage love romance movie. In my opinion, this is a sci-fi movie with some romance in it. Therefore, "Your name." is a pure art that has a lot of feeling in it. In my opinion, this is a masterpiece 5 out of 5.

Ever since I first saw the movie, it was etched in my heart as the best.I give it full marks for the studio's excellent work in creating those majestic landscapes.The director shows a brilliant mastery of narration, capable of keeping the viewer entertained and on edge throughout the film, accompanied by well-managed doses of emotion and good humor, and surprising at every moment with new twists and events that are revealed in the most appropriate moment, which ends up building a surprising story that does not falter at any time and that demonstrates an indisputable success in the assembly and planning of the sequences.But in addition, Shinkai also knows how to display a brutal greatness in traditional animation: it's not just that everything is animated - be it the leaves of the trees, the lights of the city, the clouds in the sky... or any character placed in first, second or third shot - but it is so well animated that one can breathe life into the film.

reviews.review_title: Because a beautiful animation in the world
reviews.content: First time I watch this a animation film and that's a awesome all of things. Your Name focuses on two characters and their intimate, although not sexual, relationship they have with one another. Taki, a teenage boy from Tokyo, and Mitsuha, a teenage girl from rural Japan, wake up one day to discover they have switched bodies. Taki and mitsuha a very pretty. The movie is not about two people finding out each other's names-it's about truly understanding someone else. When Taki writes his "name" in Mitsuha's hand, he doesn't actually write his name-he writes "I love you." Love is hard work and requires two people to invest in one another.

Your Name is one of my favorite anime movie from Makota Shinkai ( he's one of my favorite directors but the first one is Miyazaki of course).Although I don't like drama and romantic movies very much, it destroyed my prejudices towards these genres. It is a beautiful and high quality animation with its right voiceactor choices and interesting subject. Its about girl who changes bodies with a boy in her dreams.And at the end of the movie you understand the meaning of the name ( I like this point about movie ) I don't want to give more spoilers.Shortly, it's definitly worth watching and you should give it a chance. Enjoy watching!

I watch so many times, this is good movie. I saw so many animation movie so far this si the best of the best i ever watch.I review this with very deep concern about the producer
very good at music, combine with grafic is very easy to see.Simple extraordinary story.Kunjungi juga "Bonanza138"Art/Animation:
It's Makoto Shinkai. If movies were judged by aesthetics alone, this would be one of the best ones. There are no issues with the art. Scene composition is mostly great, the animation was very high quality, and the art style was beautiful. While there are not as many wallpaper opportunities as in 5cm/s, the quality of them is significantly higher. Watch this in the highest possible quality you can find. Worth watching for the art alone. The animation is what you'd expect from a high budget movie, but it's not anything revolutionary. There are several scenes that move beautifully and feel like magic to look at. The animation quality isn't quite up to Ghibli standards but it is nothing to scoff at.Sound:
Voice actors were quite good and played different roles effectively. The change in voice aesthetic was notable during the first half when they were body swapping. The soundtrack was unmemorable, but set the scene adequately, and it may help to broaden your horizons and expose you to new music. Sound FX and general background noise was well produced and sounded natural. The opening sequence song in particular stood out and is worth a listen, but I can't say that for most of the soundtrack.Character:
The mains were adolescents, which meant there was a lot of adolescent stuff going on in the first half. The characters were interesting initially, though none stood out as incredibly well written and became less and less captivating as the movie went on. The main positive about the characters was that they mostly felt natural, save for when they were clearly not meant to. Side characters were certainly more natural than the mains, and contributed well to the atmosphere of the movie. They develop plot stupidity and have no depth or drive other than the forced romance, and plot amnesia is introduced for added gratuitous drama. There is no reason for the characters to become stupid, or amnesiacs, and it detracts from the believability of the characters and the plot.

reviews.review_title: A must-watch film for every romance-lover, fantasy-lover or mystery-lover
reviews.content:
I love romance movies, I love fantasy movies. So, obviously this movie is a delight for me. Never ever I had thought that a anime film would top the list of all the romantic films I have watched over the years. This movie smashed all the prejudices I had towards anime films.
Though this movie is a thought-provoking one like its other Japanese counterparts, it also provides countless moments for a typical audience like me which would hold the attention throughout. Spectacularly drawn visuals, specially the fictional natural landscape of itomori town. The chemistry between the lead characters is just owwww, which surpasses the barrier of time and space. Several scenes might not make sense, but still you will want to sit through the whole movie; and by the time this film ends, I can assure you, you will be filled with a heartwarming feeling of content (just the perfect amount to make you hang over it, maybe for the rest of your life).
Enjoy.

I am a bit too generous with this 10/10 approach. so, don't expect too much from my review. 10/10 means, i liked it. That's all.Now, a bit unnecessary elaboration.The part of the movie I liked most was the world building. The images of a moderate, generic Japanese town, and the calm life style, are the parts that caught my mind. :) Such features........ mountain, lake , hill side life and a bit of Tokyo here and there...I also liked the part where the environment itself becomes very crucial for the story. You can buy a beautiful doll, but talking to a beautiful girl is more challenging and the experience worth much much more , by a very long shot. You can just draw a normal average town, but to make it interact the main story itself........ that's something precious. Bring a whole lot more flavour to the dish.The story may take a little time to be understood fully, but it felt like flowing water. No laziness, it keeps flowing .... feels like sitting in a small fountain in a hot summer day. Yes, the story is that refreshing.I forgot the names of the two main characters. It's been a few week after I have watched this movie. I forgot their name and I didn't even bother looking up in google. What's the rush? besides, they didn't even knew each other's name, and they were in the movie.. :vWhat was it, again?? Their name..??

For the first few minutes I did wonder if this was just going to be a typical comedic gender swap Anime, fortunately Your Name is much more than that and builds to be something memorable. The animation is so beautiful and detailed, the scoreFor the first few minutes I did wonder if this was just going to be a typical comedic gender swap Anime, fortunately Your Name is much more than that and builds to be something memorable. The animation is so beautiful and detailed, the score is wonderful and once the story really kicks in the script subtly shifts in tone from comedy/drama to melancholy. There's some obvious parallels at work here, male/female city/country but they are handled subtly and mostly tend to avoid predictability. Ultimately you'd have to have a heart of stone not to be moved by this.

Related media: This Japanese anime film is based on the manga of the same name, but I haven’t read it. >What's it like?: A comet passes over Japan and the lives of two people are inexplicably linked while a disaster impends. It is like aRelated media: This Japanese anime film is based on the manga of the same name, but I haven’t read it. >What's it like?: A comet passes over Japan and the lives of two people are inexplicably linked while a disaster impends. It is like a cross of two film tropes, the first being body-swapping between two people, seen in films such as Freaky Friday and Like Father Like Son, while the second trope is a spoiler. ### Move to the next paragraph now to skip this spoiler. ### The second trope is seen in a Korean film called Il Mare and its American remake called Lake House.>Pros:>1. The concept of the film is rather complex as it merges Japanese culture and its beliefs with the tropes of body-swapping and one other sci-fi trope that is a spoiler. As a result, it is a film that requires a bit of attention. However, the reward at the end is well worth it. If you are into those three elements, then you’ll love this film. However, see Cons #1.>2. I saw the American animated film, Sing, a day after watching this. The gulf in the complexity of the artwork is immense. For example, for a tree, you will see the outlines of the tree, the branches and the trunk in Sing, while the same tree in Your Name has individual leaves. Imagine the effort required to hand draw these. Imagine the effort required to animate them when there is wind! Everything is so beautifully drawn!>3. The use of the second trope in the middle of the film elevates this film from an average-good film to a good-excellent film.>4. Comedic elements covering childhood fantasies, high school angst and dating difficulties were used throughout the film to make this a partial comedy. They are very well done and they break the language barrier for the international audience.>Cons: >1. The complexity of this film makes it harder for younger children or older adults to understand it fully.2. The major problem close to end of the film was solved with a dues ex machina that was not properly explained. It need not be that way.>How would the different age groups rate it?Children: GoodTeenagers: ExcellentYoung adults: ExcellentMedium age adults: ExcellentOld adults: Good.My rating: 5/5 (no half scores). It's worth it to watch it in the cinemas and then buy the DVDs.

Your Name was one of the films that I saw at the 2016 London Film Festival and it was the highlight of the festival for me.  I absolutely adored this film.  Director Makoto Shinkai gives us an excellent movie, that you can probably nit-pick,Your Name was one of the films that I saw at the 2016 London Film Festival and it was the highlight of the festival for me.  I absolutely adored this film.  Director Makoto Shinkai gives us an excellent movie, that you can probably nit-pick, but I felt the raw power and emotion in this film and you can tell that Shinkai has done a loving job crafting this film.  Many people have put a lot of emphasis on the body swapping element of the film, which is very well done, but I think it also has the effect of cheapening the rest of the film which is also done brilliantly,  It’s a story of love, regret, and overcoming disaster and adversity and finding the solution when it seems impossible.  It’s one brilliant film and if it doesn’t get a nomination for Best Animated Feature at the Oscars, I will be extremely annoyed.  I’m really looking forward to whatever Makoto Shinkai brings out next since this beautiful animated film is easily his best work to date. Oh and the soundtrack released by the band The Radwimps is fantastic. It’s not currently available, but it will be soon.  Please, please try to see this film, even if you’re not into anime, because I think it will surprise you

This review contains spoilers, click expand to view.
        
(Kimi No Na Wa) tells the story of two teenagers with vastly different backgrounds. One is a boy who lived in Tokyo and has the word "city" described all around him. One is a girl who lived in rural town far from technology and anything interesting. One morning, somehow, they found out that they have swapped bodies. Together, they must help each other find solution in daily life problems, and solve the mystery of the reason why this whole conundrum started.This may sound like your typical body-swap romantic comedy situation, but you may find yourself on the wrong side of the spectrum as this movie takes you into an incredible journey. With a storytelling so divine, complex, yet understandable, this movie captures the essence of what romantic comedy movies have lost nowadays, a heart and a charm to lure you in.Japanese animation movies tend to have a bit of a stereotype, but the movie successfully shown very little of that. Transitioning from one scene to the other effortlessly, Radwimps deserves an incredible applause for their talents in the movie, as every song and every score fits perfectly to the scene currently shown.Although the movie does end in a predictable way, the voyage to that predictable end is more than enough to keep you satisfied. There are some usage of stock characters and several clichés throughout, something that maybe will drive some of the audiences away or cloud their judgment. But beside all that, the story is still original and well executed.What seems to be a silly premise evolved into something even more trifling. But with its unbearable charm, it worked astonishingly well.

Your Name is a lively combination of romance, identity, and culture. I went into the film with a very little understanding of the plot’s complexities. From the trailer, I assumed Your Name would be an anime Freaky Friday love story. TheYour Name is a lively combination of romance, identity, and culture. I went into the film with a very little understanding of the plot’s complexities. From the trailer, I assumed Your Name would be an anime Freaky Friday love story. The framework of the narrative certainly fits into my initial assumption. Yet, there is a multitude of undercurrents in the film which make Your Name stand out. For starters, Your Name constantly changes themes and mood. Often, I found myself laughing and, a few minutes later, would suddenly be on the verge of tears. The movie’s eclectic flow makes for a constantly engaging experience. The Freaky Friday element is roughly half of the film’s two-hour runtime. In fact, a plot twist in the film literally took my breath away. Your Name is the rare film which combines overwhelming variety and makes everything fit organically. Through variety, the anime earns a conventional ending between protagonists, Mitsuha and Taki. While body switching is the plot's main intrigue, the film adds complexity through its exploration of Japanese culture. Japanese gender identity is explored with such a masterful hand. In subtle strokes, the viewer understands the sheer contrast in the lives of Japanese men and women. For example, a group of men have a crush on a female co-worker; Mitsuha, in Taki’s body, simply initiates conversation with the desired woman and, with ease, sets up a date. When Taki is back to normal the next day, his male coworkers all line up disgusted by his act of group betrayal. The scene effectively demonstrates the strength of the herd like quality of gender in Japan. It’s no surprise then when Taki, in Mitsuha’s body, finds such humorous wonder in the breasts he suddenly gains. A contrast can also be noticed in the struggle between the past and present. The present is Taki’s experience of Tokyo. Likewise, the past is illustrated by Mitsuha’s familial duty to her small town’s local shrine. In other words, the film merges Japanese spirituality with modern sensibilities. A desire to escape and return to the country define the film’s ecliptic take on Japan. Mitsusha is your typical country girl with a thirst for a life in the city. Meanwhile, Taki finds beauty in Mitsuha’s country town. The viewer amusingly experiences each setting (Tokyo and Itomori) through the unique lens of the protagonists. Ultimately, a comet and local god guide the distant figures into a surprising collision course. As a result, fate is sealed by the two somewhat metaphysically dissimilar sources. The forces of science and divinity augment Your Name into making the seemingly fated connection all the more plausible. The film is a testament of the “opposites attract” sentiment. In summary, the film has a real beating heart. I will end my review saying Your Name is the best looking animated film I have ever seen. The colors are always pleasingly vibrant. Additionally, all of the scenes are lovingly rendered and pulsating with life. I haven’t walked out of a theatre with such a positive perspective on life in a long time. If you live in a city, you ought to take the time to experience this anime masterpiece.

They're no strangers, yet they've never met.Probably the most anticipated anime since the final film of Mr. Miyazaki. Because people know what these guys are capable of. This is one per cent sci-fi and 99 per cent fantasy. The concept isThey're no strangers, yet they've never met.Probably the most anticipated anime since the final film of Mr. Miyazaki. Because people know what these guys are capable of. This is one per cent sci-fi and 99 per cent fantasy. The concept is not new for us. From 'Freaky Friday' to 'The Lake House', even the recent American television film 'The Swap', you will remember a handful of names once you read this film's synopsis. Yet the film was so good, because of how well the theme was utilised.We all know the technical brilliance of '5 Centimeters Per Second' and the beautiful romance from 'The Garden of Words'. This is an excellent mix of those two. If love either of them, or both, then you will love it as well. But if you ask me, my favourite is still 'The Garden of Words' from this director. I liked this film, enjoyed thoroughly, so liking it less than that means not a bad flick. Surely a film to recommend for anime fans, as well as for animation's (western audience).The story of two teenagers, one from the rural Japan mountain region and the other one from Tokyo. The plot revolves around a comet that is to pass by very close to the earth. But before that event, the girl is bored with her life, so she dreams of living in a big city and that too as a boy. One day her wish comes true when she wakes up as she swapped bodies, including most of the memories with a boy from Tokyo.For her, it is to live as she wanted and make use of the opportunity. But for him, it is like a curse, hence becomes rebellious. This thing keeps happening frequently for days and weeks. After some times, realising the phenomena is between two, they make a deal and strict order of Dos and Don'ts while away. All this until the day of comet and everything changes forever. Searching for the truth and the result of it leads to the end of the tale.❝Treasure the experience. Dreams fade away after you wake up.❞Unlike Miyazaki, Makot Shinkai's storytelling is quite for the matured audience. It targets adults more than the children. Particularly for not shying away to include naturally occurring events in such situation as the story develops, despite/even though the film revolves around the teens/kids. As for this flick, the concern is not big, but it depends on the nation and its culture you belong to. It is very much acceptable and as the story progress, the best things keep replacing another till the finale. So hooked to it is assured.The film length was good and so the pace of the narration. Well written screenplay, which was based on the book of the same name. But the director admits the inspiration from the previous flicks with similar themes. They have used the real places of the anime version with fictional names, but most of the Tokyo remains same and they all were awesome.In many scenes, the camera panning was a treat. Especially the framerate was high, so no jerks, hence very pleasurable visual experience. Like I mentioned earlier, this is a unique film, despite not a original idea. The film proved the Japan is not overshadowed by Hollywood, particularly after the decline of animes in the recent years. It's up to the quality of the product, if so, then those glory days can be brought back for animes. Anyway, now this film holds the record for highest grossed anime.Apart from technical dominance, the story is also enchanting. If you like romance theme, this will serve you well. A good film for date night. But usually people would skip animation for such occasion and one should not mix up that with anime. Because why I always put apart the anime and animation is, the animes are good at beautiful romance, while its counterpart from the west focus more on comedy and adventure. But the common thing from them is the well explored fantasy theme.Usually the ends are guessable for a film like this and the same case for this in here. Only as a result of the story, you would know what's coming, but not the frame by frame scenes of it. Yeah, I liked this conclusion, the final lines said might bring you tears in your eyes, romantically, if you are an emotional person. One of the best endings, even though it was clichéd. And the credits start to roll up, while you begin to recall everything you just saw in the last 100 minutes. A must see film, so highly recommended by my side. Now I've to wait for another couple of years for such film.8/10

I was enjoying the movie so much! It's was outstanding! The characters were spectacular and perfect in their own ways. The emotions this movie can you feel is unbelievable! The graphics and animations were spot on and smooth. The characters voices fitted them perfectly! I was loving it so much and hoping the movie would end perfectly with the typical happy ending where they'd remember each other, just to make my night. But of course, in a realistic setting that fitted the characters relationship and personality. However, I reached the ending and I couldn't be any less disappointed. It basically left me on a cliffhanger that I knew would never continue. Very, very slim chance! The fact that the two main characters had finished off the movie seeing each other, passing a few times making my heart drop every time at the chance of the movie ending with them not saying anything at all. BUT they did speak! ENDING IT WITHOUT FINISHING THEIR SENTENCE! And the fact that I knew it was a slim to no chance at all that there'd be a part two made me even more devastated. The two characters saying "Your name is..." and having the view moving towards the sky and ending there made me angry, annoyed, sad and devastated. However, other than that the movie was amazing and 10/10 would highly recommend this movie, that is if you aren't as sensitive about movie endings like I am. It was a great movie and I enjoyed it while it lasted! I hope to see a part two in the future, although it's very unlikely.

Subtle and nuanced, but with the emotional weight of a sledgehammer, "Your Name" hit me so hard so many times that I was tempted to award it a 10 right away. But then, I thought I should stop to consider the complaints surrounding the film,Subtle and nuanced, but with the emotional weight of a sledgehammer, "Your Name" hit me so hard so many times that I was tempted to award it a 10 right away. But then, I thought I should stop to consider the complaints surrounding the film, and how many of them I consider to be flaws. I was also surprised to read director Makoto Shinkai personally request people stop lauding the film with blind unconditional praise, explaining there was more their team could have achieved with more time and money. After considering these things, I'm inclined to agree with him, but that won't stop me from praising the film as it is; I can definitively say this is Shinkai's best film....of little shock I'm sure is the premise of Your Name. It starts out as a sort of Teen Dramady with a body switching twist, which is quite a creative way to tell a love story I must say. Even without many scenes of the two protagonists together, you start to buy into their romance nonetheless, because when you consider they have been living each other's lives, you realize they must know about each other in ways no one else does. Eventually, they naturally decide to seek each other out, and it's here the film cleverly switches genre's. To spoil this first twist would be wrong, but it's the first of many times the film really hits you in the feels. From there, much more is at stake than the simple love story, yet Your Name manages to put equal emotional weight behind an impending tragedy and the protagonists' fear of losing their newfound connection....The story is solid, but it does suffer from the short run time. At some points, the director even had to resort to montages over what would have been important character development; presumably to save money. The exposition in the film is quite substantial, and while much of it is necessary, I wish there was a way for some of it to have been relayed in a more organic way. If you don't have your wits about you while you watch this film, especially as a Westerner with limited understanding of Eastern Religious beliefs, (Shinto in this case,) you're not going to hear the things you'll need to understand the film's climax and resolution. In this way, the film makes your brain work harder than a typical cinematic outing....As one final flaw, the male protagonist Taki felt quite underdeveloped compared to his female counterpart Mitsuha. He had few character defining traits shown, besides a moment where his short temper shocks classmates of the normally reserved Mitsuha. His relationship with his father in particular wasn't explored at all, when it should have been. We know some things about his interests and lifestyle, but again, little that could be considered character defining. We know far more about Mitsuha as most of the screentime is about her. A more balanced development would have been better....With flaws out of the way, and there weren't many, I still fully recommend this film to anyone interested in Anime. Its strengths far outweigh its problems. The animation, for one, is immaculate. It really serves to compliment the story visually, even if that story isn't as fully developed as it could be. While the pop singles were somewhat distracting due to the vocals, the soundtrack as a whole is solid. I thoroughly enjoyed hearing the movie as much as watching it. I mentioned the film is emotionally heavy. Well, it's hard to explain, but imagine that feeling of loss when you risk losing someone near to you, that feeling of familiarity even though you can't specifically remember someone or something, and that teenage impulse to escape from your boring secure life and live out something more exciting. Those are the feelings this film invokes, and does so quite well. To go into more detail would take too long, so please just trust me on this....Also, unlike several of the director's previous films, Your Name has a satisfying ending. I was afraid we'd be left with another "5 cm per Second" kind of ending, but am glad to report the film ends conclusively. For me, it's complete as it is; I don't want a sequel. What I really wanted then, was more out of this film. It really needed another hour to develop the characters and story further, but Shinkai can hardly be blamed for this, considering he seems to feel the same, but ran out of time and money to do so. Well, if this is what he can accomplish in a mere hour and a half, I can't wait to see what he'll achieve if given the creative freedom a larger budget would allow. Definitely keep an eye out for more films by this director. 9/10

I can't think of any anime movie I've seen that had a better combination of animation and story quality.  The tension I felt at the end of the movie, and the emotional release at the end felt epic.  The movie kept building up, and while I agree that Makoto Shinkai might have been able to make this movie even better, I still give this film a 10.  His only competition in trying to make a better movie would be himself.  I'm sure there are some that may not enjoy the subject matter, or may not like the concept, but I thought this was beautiful, awesome combination of some of my favorite plot devices/situations - one of them being two people swapping bodies, but it really got crazy as the film kept going.  I think this one is worth watching more than once.  3 movies I watched years ago had elements which were recaptured and reused in Your Name.  Freaky Friday (which really doesn't have much else in common except two people's minds switching bodies).  The Lake House, which involves two people communicating with each other but never meetings and (major spoiler) communicating between different time periods.  And Memento - which takes some re-watches because it's presented out of chronological order, or in a non standard order of events, and also involves writing things down in places so you can remember, and forgetting things very quickly.   I loved all these elements of Your Name.  It also have a gigantic, and devastating explosion, feels like every movie could use at least one, for dramatic effect.  The movie had humor, it had romance, it brings a sense of longing, it had some great music, and amazing animation, both the character animation, the camera/motion effects, the scenery. I'm a huge fan of Miyazaki movies, and for a very long time Studio Ghibli was my gold standard of anime, it's the best of the best quality.  Makoto Shinkai has impressed me time and time again and this was the absolute best I've seen from him.  Fantastic movie.  And he, in my mind, is standing alongside Miyazaki in greatness.

This movie has a lot of aspects to draw people in. Kimi no Na wa has romance, supernatural elements, some time travel. They all come together to give a very impactful and interesting story. The movie opens up immediately into the plot which causes viewers to question what is going on causing them to become engaged in the story and wonder where all the plot points are going. I highly recommend checking this movie out as I believe it has a little bit of something for everyone. Interesting plot development, good character dynamics, and a heartwarming story. Funimation has announced that Kimi no Na wa(aka Your Name) will be released in North American Theaters on April 7th, 2017. The film already premiered in 2016 at Anime Expo in Los Angeles. I believe this is where I will take my leave folks. As always, I am The Gentleman Snark, SEE YA!!

A boy and a girl switch bodies - perhaps a somewhat cheesy premise, but Your Name gets every bit of mileage from it and more.Albeit a romantic drama, the movie does an excellent job at easing you in with the natural comedy of the situation.A boy and a girl switch bodies - perhaps a somewhat cheesy premise, but Your Name gets every bit of mileage from it and more.Albeit a romantic drama, the movie does an excellent job at easing you in with the natural comedy of the situation. The protagonists' reactions are so lovely that they grew on me in no time.Your Name's pacing does an excellent job at this - it gives the characters and (almost as prominent) sets enough time to fully develop, but also drives breathtaking action. Combined with the gorgeous soundtrack and brilliantly used nonlinear narration, it keeps both heart and mind engaged. The stunning visuals do the rest. And of course, at some point it will hit you right in the heart.While some parts around the middle may appear a little contrived, and the mixing time lines can create some momentary confusion, the clarification and payoff always come in due time.Your Name musters all the strengths of anime as a medium, and their makers expertise. Now, Tearjerkers like this will always have to justify themselves against accusations of being formulaic, as romance writers (especially in the anime industry) have all too much experience manipulating our emotions. But Your Name manages to always throw a little extra in there, and executes everything with breathtaking perfection. In a movie year where so many seemed to stumble even over the basics, it is good to see a movie that just does things so right. In a time where CGI has blurred the characters of Hollywood productions into one, it is fulfilling to see such wonderful art. Your Name was my movie of the year before I was even half way through, and only grew from there.
Just watched it for the first time, one of my all time favourites already!!
